title: How to write a good product review - Quora

response.answer_text: Regardless of good or bad, a product review must be able to give the reader something that is useful and usable. Usefulness and usableness override everything else. The tech details, the performance stats, you name it -- all are necessary and I think you know how to do them. But lots of product reviews are chockful of details without being actually useful or usable because they don't have the expected product user's expectations in mind. Other than that, a good, solid product review is bound to be a longish piece of writing. So you would have to intersperse lots of big, closeup images of the product in various angles and operating modes to get the point across. Annotations within the images really helps, but strangely not always seen in product reviews. On the score of writing, be sure to keep facts relatively together, expectations relatively together, and opinions relatively together (and neutral-sounding). Nothing else special to do. Your technical knowledge should guide you what's in and what's out for the piece.

Reviewing a product is a very responsible job. A lot of people may read your review and take decisions based on it. So to write a good review following points must be taken care of Be honest! Writing biased reviews will eventually become obvious to the reader and he might not come backExperience the product. If you write a review without actually using It, the reader will make this out.Use pictures, but useful pictures. Post pictures of the product but don't put the pictures that depict the same thing as the product’s advertisement. Use meaningful pictures. For example when i review lipsticks i not only show how it looks like from the outside but also how the shade looks when appliedUse bullet point. Most of the readers want quick tabular kind of informationCompare. Compare the product with other products you might have used so to give the reader an idea of itWrite pros and cons of the product. In fact highlight it.Be precise and use easy language
